articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Mohammad Salem, Maayan Lubell
articles.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu will convene his security cabinet on Thursday evening to discuss new Hamas positions on a ceasefire deal in Gaza, a source in Netanyahu's office said, as fighting in the enclave raged.
articles.title: Israel weighs Hamas response to Gaza ceasefire proposal

articles.author: Kate Holton
articles.description: Britain looks set to elect Labour Party leader Keir Starmer as its next prime minister when voters go to the polls on Thursday, sweeping Rishi Sunak's Conservatives out of office after 14 often turbulent years.
articles.title: Labour predicted to rout Sunak's Conservatives as Britain goes to polls

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Chinese President Xi Jinping urged members of a regional security club on Thursday to resist external meddling, while President Vladimir Putin was due to speak about creating a new Eurasian security system at the group's annual meeting.
articles.title: Xi and Putin set out ambitions for Eurasian security club

articles.author: John Davison, Emma Farge, Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Mohammed describes a delivery job from hell.
articles.title: Insight: Feeding Gaza: Traders run gauntlet of bullets, bombs and bribes

articles.author: Dominique Vidalon
articles.description: Some 30,000 police will be deployed across France late on Sunday following the high-stakes runoff of a parliamentary election to ensure there is no trouble, a minister said, as two candidates said they had been victims of attacks on the campaign trail.
articles.title: France to deploy more police to prevent trouble after Sunday election

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Romania's ruling coalition of leftist Social Democrats and centre-right Liberals has agreed to hold a presidential election on Nov. 24 and Dec. 8, with parliamentary polls in between, they said on Thursday.
articles.title: Romanian ruling coalition agrees parliamentary, presidential election dates

articles.author: Laurie Chen
articles.description: Some foreign companies are considering moving Taiwanese employees out of China after Beijing said it could impose the death penalty on "diehard" Taiwan independence separatists, said four people familiar with the matter.
articles.title: Exclusive: Firms weigh removing Taiwan staff from China after death penalty threat

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Indian police said on Thursday they had arrested six people in connection with the stampede at a Hindu religious event in the northern state of Uttar Pradesh this week in which 121 people were killed.
articles.title: Six arrested in connection with stampede in north India, police say

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: More than 136,000 people have fled Sudan's southeastern Sennar state since the paramilitary Rapid Support Forces began a series of attacks on towns, the United Nations said on Wednesday, the latest wave of displacement caused by Sudan's almost 15-month long war.
articles.title: More than 136,000 displaced by spread of war in southeast Sudan, UN says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Hurricane Beryl rumbled towards the Cayman Islands and Mexico on Thursday, after pummeling Jamaica with winds and rain that caused floods and widespread power outages and leaving a deadly trail of destruction in several smaller Caribbean islands.
articles.title: Hurricane Beryl heads for Cayman Islands, Mexico after striking Jamaica
